content.description:
ENGLISH TRADE IN POUNDS STERLING FOR SELECTED YEARS IN THE EIGHTEENTH CENTURY YEARS 1700–01 1750–51 1772–73 Imports Total World Trade 5,819,000 7,855,000 12,432,000 Total Atlantic Trade 1,181,000 2,404,000 4,602,000 Atlantic Portion 20.2% 30.6% 37% Exports Total World Trade 6,597,000 12,553,000 15,539,000 Total Atlantic Trade 843,000 2,131,000 5,096,000 Atlantic Portion 12.7% 16.9% 32.7% Source: Adapted from Thomas Benjamin, The Atlantic World: Europeans, Africans, Indians and Their Shared History, 1400-1900, Cambridge University Press, 2009, p. 490.

Atlantic trade is defined as trade between English ports and ports on the Atlantic other than those in Europe.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the trend in England’s total trade with the world shown in the table?

choices.label: Both imports and exports decreased in the period 1700 to 1773.
Both imports and exports increased in the period 1700 to 1773.
Imports increased in the period 1700 to 1773, but exports decreased.
Imports decreased in the period 1700 to 1773, but exports increased.

content.answer: Both imports and exports increased in the period 1700 to 1773.

unit.text: 5: Conflict, Crisis, and Reaction in the Late 18th Century

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
